rawTags.definition-en: An enclosed and/or covered structure, above and/or below ground, intended either for the shelter of persons, animals or things, or for the production of economic goods or the provision of services, and refers to any structure permanently constructed or erected on its site.

rawTags.definition-nl: Totaal van het aantal ondergrondse gebouwlagen, bekeken over alle gebouwdelen heen.
rawTags.definition-en: Total number of building layers under ground, viewed across all building sections.
rawTags.usageNote-en: This starts usually from the level where the main entrance is located.

rawTags.definition-nl: Totaal van het aantal bovengrondse gebouwlagen, bekeken over alle gebouwdelen heen.
rawTags.definition-en: Total number of building layers above ground, viewed across all building sections.
rawTags.usageNote-en: This starts usually from the level where the main entrance is located.

rawTags.definition-en: Number of dwellings. A dwelling is a residential unit which may consist of one or several rooms designed for the occupation of households.
Name of the building
The legal use of the building.
The interior installation(s) serving the building.
Height above ground.
Reference to an external information system containing any piece of information related to the spatial object.
The location where the building can be entered or exited.
Any document providing information about the building.
Values indicating the condition of a construction.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Condition of Construction code list.

rawTags.definition-en: The parcel(s) with which the building is officially associated.
Building unit(s) being part of the building.

rawTags.ap-usageNote-en:
This attribute focuses on the physical aspect (facade) of the building; however, this physical aspect is often expressed as a function (e.g. stadium, silo, windmill); this attribute aims to fulfil mainly mapping purposes and addresses only specific, noticeable buildings.

More information about the enumerations can be found on the INSPIRE Building Nature code list.
rawTags.definition-en: Characteristic of the building that makes it generally of interest for mappings applications. The characteristic may be related to the physical aspect and/or to the function of the building.
Building unit(s) being part of the building.
The parcel(s) with which the building is officially associated.
Vertically-constrained dimensional property consisting of an absolute measure referenced to a well-defined surface which is commonly taken as origin (geo√Ød, water level, etc.).
rawTags.name: Building.elevation

rawTags.definition-en: Date of renovation.
rawTags.name: Building.dateOfRenovation

rawTags.definition-en: Date of demolition.
rawTags.name: Building.dateOfDemolition

rawTags.definition-en: Date of construction.
rawTags.name: Building.dateOfConstruction

rawTags.definition-en: Activity hosted within the building. This attribute addresses mainly the buildings hosting human activities.
rawTags.usageNote-en: This attribute aims to fulfill management requirements, such as computation of population or spatial planning ; this classification aims to be exhaustive for the functional buildings hosting human activities.
rawTags.name: Building.currentUse

rawTags.definition-en: The address representation that corresponds to the building.

rawTags.name: Building.geometry
rawTags.definition-en: Shape and position characteristics of a building.
Identifier of the Building.

rawTags.definition-nl: De kleinste eenheid binnen een gebouw die geschikt is voor woon-, bedrijfsmatige, of recreatieve doeleinden en die ontsloten wordt via een eigen afsluitbare toegang vanaf de openbare weg, een erf of een gedeelde circulatieruimte. Een gebouweenheid is in functioneel opzicht zelfstandig. Daarnaast kan een gebouweenheid ook een gemeenschappelijk deel zijn.
rawTags.definition-en: The smallest unit within a building that is suitable and adapted for residential, commercial or recreational purposes and which is accessible from the outside or from a common area. A building unit is atomic, functionally independent, and may be separately sold, rented out, inherited, etc. In addition, a building unit can also be a common part.
The legal use of the building unit.
The location where the building unit can be entered or exited.
Any document providing information about the building unit.
Activity hosted within the building unit. This attribute addresses mainly the building units hosting human activities.
rawTags.name: BuildingUnit.currentUse

rawTags.definition-en: Date of renovation.
rawTags.name: BuildingUnit.dateOfRenovation

rawTags.definition-en: Date of demolition
rawTags.name: BuildingUnit.dateOfDemolition

rawTags.definition-en: Date of construction.
rawTags.name: BuildingUnit.dateOfConstruction

rawTags.definition-en: The address representation that corresponds to the building unit.
Shape and position characteristics of a building unit.
rawTags.name: Buildingunit.geometry

rawTags.definition-en: The unique identifier of a building unit.
A portion of Belgian territory, geographically demarcated and identified by the AAPD on the cadastral plot plan, corresponding to the land area of one or more cadastral patrimonial plots.
An internal construction (generally or small size) or an internal device, serving the building.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Example: stairs, lift

rawTags.definition-en: The nature of the internal installation.
3D geometric representation of the internal installation.

External unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may
be used by external applications to reference the spatial object.
This data types includes the geometry of the building and metadata information about which element of the building was captured and how.
The estimated absolute positional accuracy of the Z-coordinate of the building geometry.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: Absolute positional accuracy is defined as the mean value of the positional uncertainties for a set of positions where the positional uncertainties are defined as the distance between a measured position and what is considered as the corresponding true position.

rawTags.definition-nl: Geometrie die moet worden gebruikt bv bij voorstelling op kaart.
rawTags.definition-en: The geometry to be taken into account by view services, for portrayal.
The estimated absolute positional accuracy of the (X,Y) coordinates of the building geometry.
Data type grouping the 3D geometry of a building or building part and the metadata information attached to this geometry.
rawTags.usageNote-en: More information about LoD can be found via this link: https://docs.ogc.org/is/20-010/20-010.html#toc0

rawTags.definition-en: Height level to which the lower height of the model (Z-value of the lower horizontal polygon) refers to.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.

rawTags.definition-en: Line or multi-line where the spatial object touches the terrain representation.
Representation of the outer boundary by a solid.
Representation of the outer boundary by a Multi Surface, which may - in contrast to a solid representation - not be topologically clean. In particular, the ground surface may be missing.
Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD 1 representation.

rawTags.ap-usageNote-en:
Example: generalRoof, lowestRoof edge.

Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.
rawTags.definition-en: Height level to which the upper height of the model (Z-value of the upper horizontal polygon) refers to.

rawTags.ap-usageNote-en:
Example: footprint, roof edge.

Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Horizontal Geometry Reference code list.
rawTags.definition-en: Element of the real world object that was captured by the (X,Y) coordinates of the LoD1 Multisurface or Solid geometry.
rawTags.name: BuildingGeometry3DLoD1.horizontalGeometryReference

rawTags.definition-en: Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD2 representation.
rawTags.name: BuildingGeometry3DLoD2.horizontalGeometryReference

rawTags.ap-usageNote-en:
Example: footprint, roof edge.

Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Horizontal Geometry Reference code list.
rawTags.definition-en: Element that was captured by the (X,Y) coordinates of the LoD2 MultiSurface or Solid geometry.
Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD3 representation.
Data type grouping the specific metadata attached to the 3D geometry, when provided by a LoD4 representation.
This data type enables to detail the current use(s).
The current use of a building.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Example: trade, entertainment, ...

rawTags.definition-en: The proportion of the building, given as a percentage, devoted to this current use.
This data type includes the different possible ways to define the date of an event.
Date and time when the event begun.
Date and time when the event ended.
A date and time of any point of the event, between its beginning and its end.
Vertically-constrained dimensional property consisting of an absolute measure referenced to a well-defined surface which is commonly taken as origin (geo√Ød, water level, etc.).
Value of the elevation.
Element where the elevation was measured.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.

rawTags.definition-en: The location where the building (unit) can be entered or exited.
Holder of the coordinates of a position in a coordinate reference system.
The address linked to the location of the entrance.
Reference to an external information system containing any piece of information related to the spatial object.
Thematic identifier of the spatial object or of any piece of information related to the spatial object.
The name of the external information system.
rawTags.usageNote-en: EXAMPLES: Danish Register of Dwellings, Spanish Cadastre

rawTags.definition-en: Uniform Resource Identifier of the external information system.
Proper noun applied to a real world entity.
rawTags.usageNote-en: This can be substituted by LangString

rawTags.definition-en: A proper way of writing the geographical name.

Original data source from which the geographical name is taken from and integrated in the data set providing/publishing it. For some named spatial objects it might refer again to the publishing data set if no other information is available.
Information enabling to acknowledge if the name is the one that is/was used in the area where the spatial object is situated at the instant when the name is/was in use.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Nativeness code list.

rawTags.definition-en: Qualitative information enabling to discern which credit should be given to the name with respect to its standardisation and/or its topicality.
rawTags.usageNote-en: NOTE The Geographical Names application schema does not explicitly make a preference between different names (e.g. official endonyms) of a specific real world entity. The necessary information for making the preference (e.g. the linguistic status of the administrative or geographic area in question), for a certain use case, must be obtained from other data or information sources. For example, the status of the language of the name may be known through queries on the geometries of named places against the geometry of administrative units recorded in a certain source with the language statuses information. Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Name Status code list.

rawTags.definition-en: Vertical distance (measured or estimated) between a low reference and a high reference.
Value of the height above ground.
The way the height has been captured.
Element as the low reference.
rawTags.usageNote-en: EXAMPLE: the height of the building has been captured from its the lowest ground point.

rawTags.definition-en: Element used as the high reference.
rawTags.usageNote-en:
EXAMPLE: The height of the building has been captured up to the top of building.

Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.

rawTags.definition-en: A representation of a unit.
Standard units of measurements used when accounting for stock, and expressing them in quantities.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the EU Vocabulary Measurement unit.

rawTags.definition-en: A property to relate a unit with a value.
The official code of the language.
Identifier of an object broken down into its parts.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Een 3-dimensionele geometrische primitieve.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-nl: Dimensie is te verstaan in wiskundige zin: het minimum aantal co√∂rdinaten nodig om een willekeurig punt voor te stellen dat deel uitmaakt van de primitieve. Om een willekeurig punt aan te duiden in de ruimte die het 3Dobject inneemt zijn 3 co√∂rdinaten nodig. Een 3DObject heeft daarom lengte, breedte en diepte. Analoog aan de polylijn (di een Curve onstaan door interpolatie tussen twee of meer punten) bestaan er ook in 3 dimensies vormen die gedefinieerd worden door sets van controlepunten. Een 3DObject wordt begrensd door meerdere Vlakken (bv kubus) of door 1 gesloten Vlak (bv bol). Bijkomende grensvlakken vormen mogelijks holtes in het 3DObject. Om binnen- en buitengrenzen te kunnen onderscheiden geldt doorgaans de afspraak dat het 3DObject links ligt van het Vlak waardoor het wordt begrensd.
rawTags.definition-en: A 3-dimensional geometric primitive.

rawTags.definition-nl: Houder van de co√∂rdinaten van een positie in een co√∂rdinaatreferentiesysteem.
rawTags.usageNote-nl: Typisch gebruikt om de geometrie van een ruimtelijk object te beschrijven of de geometrische primitieven (bv punt, Lijn, Vlak...) waaruit dat object is samengesteld. Een DirectePositie kan echter ook op zichzelf staan om een positie in de ruimte te beschrijven. De positie wordt gegeven in een co√∂rdinaatreferentiesysteem. Dat referentiesysteem wordt expliciet bij de DirectePositie opgegeven, tenzij deze deel uitmaakt van een ruimtelijk object (bv een geometrische primitieve) waar al een referentiesysteem wordt vermeld. Ter info: Een co√∂rdinaatreferentiesysteem verschilt van een indirect ruimtelijk referentiesysteem in die zin dat posities direct dmv co√∂rdinaten worden opgegeven ipv indirect door een adres of plaatsnaam.
rawTags.definition-en: Holder of the coordinates of a position in a coordinate reference system.

rawTags.definition-nl: De manier waarop het punt werd bepaald.
rawTags.definition-en: The way the point was determined.
Direct position expressed in wkt format.
Direct position expressed in gml format.
A MultiCurve is a 1-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Curves.
A MultiSurface is a 2-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Surfaces, all using coordinates from the same coordinate reference system.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Een 0-dimensionele geometrische primitieve.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-nl: Dimensie is te verstaan in wiskundige zin: het minimum aantal co√∂rdinaten nodig om een willekeurig punt voor te stellen dat deel uitmaakt van de primitieve. In het co√∂rdinaatsysteem dat door een Punt zelf gevormd wordt is geen enkele co√∂rdinaat nodig, er is immers maar 1 punt. Een Punt heeft daarom geen breedte, lengte of diepte. OPGELET: dat betekent niet dat een Punt geen co√∂rdinaten kan hebben in een ander co√∂rdinaatysteem, bv xyz-co√∂rdinaten in en 3-assig orthogonaal co√∂rdinaatsysteem.
rawTags.definition-en: A 0-dimensional geometrical primitive.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Oppervlak bestaande uit 1 buitengrens en 0 of meer binnengrenzen. Elke binnengrens vormt een gat in de polygoon.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-nl: De grenzen zijn zgn lineaire ringen,ttz het zijn gesloten (niet zelfsnijdende) lijnstringen. De buitengrens wordt onderscheiden vd binnengrens door resp de kloksgewijze en tegenkloksgewijze richting waarin de ring loopt.
rawTags.definition-en: Surface consisting of one outer boundary and 0 or more inner boundaries. Each internal boundary forms a hole in the polygon.
A URI that is technically represented as a class in RDF, but is a literal in use.
A linear sequence of characters, words, or other data.
Information used to uniquely identify an object.
rawTags.usageNote-en: The basic assumption here is that this string is assigned by an organization and that this is done according to a well-defined system.

rawTags.definition-en: Identifier of the object broken down into its parts.
Name of the agent who assigned the identifier.
String used to uniquely identify the object.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Type of the string refers to the identifier (incl its version), the string itself to the actual identifier.

rawTags.definition-en: Time when the identifier was issued.
Link to the agent who issued the identifier.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Meer leesbare voorstelling met enkel de basisgegevens van het adres,bedoeld voor het gebruik van een adres als attribuut van een ander object.
rawTags.definition-en: More readable representation with only the basic data of the address, intended to use an address as an attribute of another object.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: The scope of this class is broad and is meant to capture generic address representations, aligned with INSPIRE. For Belgian addresses and derived implementations it is advised to align with BeST

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Straatnaam vh adres.
rawTags.definition-en: Streetname of the address.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Naam waarmee het geografisch gebied dat adressen voor postale doeleinden groepeert wordt aangeduid.
rawTags.definition-en: Name designating the geographical area that groups addresses for postal purposes.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Code waarmee het geografisch gebied dat adressen voor postale doeleinden groepeert wordt aangeduid.
rawTags.definition-en: Code designating the geographical area that groups addresses for postal purposes.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Postbusnummer in een postkantoor.
rawTags.definition-en: PO Box number in a post office.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Naam of omschrijving vh het geografisch object dat de adreslocator aanduidt.
rawTags.definition-en: Name or description of the geographic object that the address locator identifies.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Alfanumerieke code die de adreslocator uniek identificeert binnen de straat, administratieve eenheid etc.
rawTags.definition-en: Alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies the address locator within the street, administrative unit, etc.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Het complete adres in √©√©n string, al dan niet geformatteerd.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-nl: Vermijdt fouten tgv het opsplitsen ve adres in zijn onderdelen. Geeft de voorgeschreven volgorde vd verschillende onderdelen weer.
rawTags.definition-en: The complete address in one string, formatted or not.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: De regio vh adres, doorgaans een provincie of deelstaat of gelijkaardig gebied dat typisch meerdere plaatsen omvat.
rawTags.definition-en: The region of the address, usually a province or state or similar area typically comprising several towns.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Hoogste Administratieve eenheid vh adres, doorgaans een land.
rawTags.definition-en: Highest Administrative Unit of address, usually a country.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Naam ve geografisch gebied of plaats die een aantal adresseerbare objecten groepeert om deze te adresseren zonder dat het gebied of de plaats een administratieve eenheid is
rawTags.ap-usageNote-nl: Bvb de naam vh gehucht waarin het adres ligt.
rawTags.definition-en: Name of a geographical area or locality that groups a number of addressable objects for the purpose of addressing them without the area or locality being an administrative unit.
Address from which the address representation is derived.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Gemeentenaam vh adres.
rawTags.definition-en: Municipal name of the address.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Alfanumerieke code officieel toegekend aan gebouweenheden, ligplaatsen, standplaatsen of percelen.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-nl: Specialisatie van Adresvoorstelling:locatieaanduiding tbv Belgische adressen.
rawTags.definition-en: Alphanumeric code officially assigned to building units, berths, pitches or parcels.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: This should be either purely numerical or a series of numbers followed by a letter.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Land waarin het adres gelegen is.
rawTags.definition-en: Country in which the address is located.

rawTags.ap-usageNote-nl: Specialisatie van Adresvoorstelling:locatieaanduiding tbv Belgische adressen.
rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Officieel toegekende alfanumerieke code die wordt toegevoegd aan het huisnummer om meerdere gebouweenheden, standplaatsen, ligplaatsen of percelen te onderscheiden die eenzelfde huisnummer hebben.
rawTags.definition-en: Officially assigned alphanumeric code added to the house number to distinguish multiple building units, pitches, moorings or plots that have the same house number.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: While not advisable to do according to common BeST practices, optionally the block, floor, etc. can be specified here too.

rawTags.definition-en: The name or names of a unit of administration where a Member State has and/or exercises jurisdictional rights, for local, regional and national governance.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Vorm- en positiekenmerken van een object.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-nl: Beschrijft deze kenmerken dmv punten, lijnen, polygonen en co√∂rdinaten.
rawTags.definition-en: Shape and position characteristics of an object.
The way the point was determined.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Geometrie uitgedrukt in wkt-formaat.
rawTags.definition-en: Geometry expressed in wkt format.

rawTags.ap-definition-nl: Geometrie uitgedrukt in gml-formaat.
rawTags.definition-en: Geometry expressed in gml format.

rawTags.definition-nl: Geometrie van het gebouw en metadata over welk deel van het gebouw door de geometrie wordt voorgesteld en hoe deze werd bepaald.
rawTags.definition-en: This data types includes the geometry in 2D or 2.5D of the building and metadata information about which element of the building was captured and how.

rawTags.definition-nl: Aspect van het object dat door de z-co√∂rdinaten wordt voorgesteld.
rawTags.definition-en: Element of the building that was captured by vertical coordinates.
rawTags.usageNote-en: Concepts of this codelist should be used from the INSPIRE Elevation Reference code list.

rawTags.definition-en: 2D or 2.5D geometric representation of the building.

rawTags.definition-nl: Aspect van het object dat door de xy-co√∂rdinaten wordt voorgesteld.
rawTags.definition-en: Element of the building that was captured by (X,Y) coordinates.
rawTags.name: BuildingGeometry2D.horizontalGeometryReference

rawTags.definition-en: Any document providing information about a building or building unit.
rawTags.usageNote-en: EXAMPLES: the building permit, a photo of facade or inner yard, a sketch of interior, the building code, the energy performance assessment, an emergency plan

rawTags.definition-en: The status of the document, i.e. this attribute indicates if the document comes from official source or not.
A short text providing overview of the document content. May be just title of the document.
Date of validity of the document.
rawTags.usageNote-en: EXAMPLES: the date the photo was taken, the date the sketch was done or approved, the date the building permit was accepted
